title: 106_hr447
content: The curr_chunk is a section titled "LANDS TITLE REPORT COMMISSION." Establishment of the Lands Title Report Commission to facilitate home loan mortgages on Indian trust lands. The Commission will consist of 12 members appointed by the President and the Chairperson of the Committee on Banking and Financial Services of the House of Representatives. The Lands Title Report Commission will have 12 members appointed by the President and the Chairperson of the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate. At least 8 members must be from federally recognized Indian tribes and all members must have experience in land title matters related to Indian trust lands. The Chairperson will be elected from the appointed members, and vacancies on the Commission will be filled accordingly. The Commission, consisting of 12 members appointed by the President and the Chairperson of the Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs, will fill vacancies in the same manner as the original appointment. Members will not receive pay but will be reimbursed for travel expenses. The Chairperson will call the initial meeting within 30 days of adequate funding. The Commission's duties include analyzing the Bureau of Indian Affairs' system for maintaining land ownership records and issuing certified titles. The Commission will analyze the system for maintaining land ownership records and issuing certified titles for Indian trust lands. They will determine improvements to ensure prompt responses, eliminate backlogs, and facilitate Native Americans' ability to obtain loans for residences on these lands. A report must be submitted before the Commission's termination date. The Commission will submit a report to Congress detailing their analysis and determinations. They have the power to hold hearings, take testimony, and request assistance from federal agencies. The Commission has the authority to obtain official data from US departments or agencies, use the US mails, and receive administrative support services from the Administrator of General Services to fulfill its duties. The Commission may appoint personnel in accordance with title 5, United States Code, and pay them based on General Schedule pay rates. $500,000 is authorized for appropriations, remaining available until expended. The Commission will terminate one year after its initial meeting.
